snippet: While a copyright infringement case focuses on the sheet music version of a Robin Thicke hit, the trial raises questions about the music industry and one artist’s debt to another.
abstract: Pop singer Robin Thicke is enmeshed in lawsuit over copyright infringement that has raised questions about plagiarism and offered insight into darker side of music industry; amidst claims by family of Marvin Gaye that Pharrell Williams and Thicke's 2013 hit song Blurred Lines used elements from one of Gaye's songs, Thicke has testified that he did not write hit, despite a credit.

byline.contributor: Noah Smith and Joe Coscarelli contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: While a copyright infringement case focuses on the sheet music version of a Robin Thicke hit, the trial raises questions about the music industry and one artist’s debt to another.

headline.main: Industry Issues Intrude in ‘Blurred Lines’ Case
headline.print_headline: Side Issues Intrude in ‘Blurred Lines’ Case
